reviewText: I have and like much of Jill Miller's media.  In fact, that's what made me so hesitant to pick up this DVD--i.e., the idea that it would duplicate material that I already owned.  But, now that I finally did break down and purchase this DVD, I can't believe that I waited so long!  In addition to a yoga mat, you will need a block and two of Jill's Yoga Tune-Up Balls for these routines.  (If you don't have the balls, you can subAmazing PINKY Hi- Bounce Balls: 2.25 Inch Party Favor; they should work just as well.)QuickFix Rx Upper Body addresses four "micro regions" of the body:  Neck, Shoulders, Upper Back, and finally, Hands, Wrists, & Elbows.  Here is what you will find on the Main Menu:About Yoga Tune-UpIntroductionPlay All QuickFixesNeck*QuickFix VideosShoulders*QuickFix VideosUpper Back*QuickFix VideosHands, Wrists, & Elbows*QuickFix VideosIf you select any of the "Quick Fix Videos" options, you are taken to a submenu.  Here is what a sample submenu looks like:*Quickfix Introduction*5 Minute Quickfix*Quickfix Introduction*10 Minute Quickfix*Play Both Quickfixes*Back to Main MenuAs you can see, these menus are NOT the most user-friendly and a bit unwieldy to navigate!  The Introductions to each Quickfix segment are generally quite brief (30-40 seconds), but it also seems completely unnecessary to have them as separate menu sections.I offer brief breakdowns for each segment below, along with accurate time information in parentheses (some of the segments aren't actually 5 or 10 minutes long).NECK5 minute (5m):  starts with a stretch, incorporates self-massage using a ball, ends with an isometric stretch10 minute (10m):  seated in chair for series of isometric contractions from all directions; also includes some stretches, and ends on the floor for upper back rollingSHOULDERS5 minute (5m):  very quick-moving series of shoulder circles (both front/back and lateral), milking shoulders, and bridge arms in standing10-minute (12m):  opens with pranic bath; incorporates new moves such as "blockhead" and "railroad piston arms" as well as moves which appear on Jill's other DVDs, including open sesame and reverse crucifix; ends with cow-face arms and ball work on floorUPPER BACK5 minute (6m):  starts seated for cat/cow, adding rotation and deep side bending; finish with forward bend10 minute (9.5m):  start on hands and knees for cat/cow, then move into child's pose variations; also includes cobra, drunken table, and massage work with ballsHANDS, WRISTS, & ELBOWS5 minute (5m):  several gripping moves work hands/fingers plus several moves to stretch the forearms10 minutes (7.5m):  starts with a hula wave and forearm self-massage ("squeezing the toothpaste"); continues with eagle arms and a wrist stretch on the floorAgain, I am really happy that I finally purchased this.  Although some of the material IS familiar to me from Jill's other DVDs--for example, as noted above, the 10 Minute Shoulder Quickfix has exercises which also appear on Jill'sYoga Tune Up: Athletic Stretch Routines With Jill Miller, another DVD of hers that I own--there is plenty here that is new as well.  Furthermore, I really like the short length of the practices (as opposed to the DVDs in Jill's Yoga Link series, some of which I enjoyed but which I eventually got rid of because I wasn't using), AND I also like the fact that all of the 10-minute practices (except the hand/wrist/elbow one) finish with ball work after the postures.  If you are on the fence about this DVD, I highly recommend it!
summary: Wonderful short practices that are great for both prehabbing and rehabbing the upper body!

reviewText: I have issues with my serratus muscles, that no DVD of the hundred or more I've previewed and/or used has addressed. Nearly fell over to hear the word used on this fabulous DVD. Though traveling soon, I'll return and buy what is unfortunately NOT offer by amazon. The specialized yoga balls ( tennis balls will do, but I'm gonna wear this out of use) and CD of it. If you have any back issue that short term massage, Chiro, cupping, etc. helps...give this a try for DIY help.

reviewText: I am totally enamoured of this DVD.  Jill Miller is a genius, and she has my everlasting gratitutde for producing this series.  I had bought the three yoga link DVDs but found them a little daunting - even though I regularly practice pilates and quite regularly practice yoga.  I suffer from tightness in my right hip/top of leg, and left inner thigh and hip flexor - which not only hurt but make me walk funny too!  I also have very tight shoulders and chest and a painful neck - and painful elbows too! - probably because of computer and knitting and sewing..... I bought this and the lower body DVD and tried them both yesterday. WOW!  I haven't felt this good for a long long time - loose, open, straight, stretched out.  They are feasible for everyone - even my very unfit and tight shouldered sister.  The relief I felt is incredible.  Now, I normally do pilates at least three times a week, and afterwards do a short yoga session of around 25 minutes to relax me and stretch out the weak spots.  This is so much better.  I ended up doing all the quickfixes - the short 5 minute and the longer (10 minutes only!) for each section - because they felt so wonderful!  Her self massage techniques are incredible.  The stretches and strengtheners in these DVDs are practically all unique - and this is someone with an enormous collection of DVDs talking here, people (at least 300... ahem).  The sessions are so well thought out.  And she also has a cute sense of humour, which helps.....HIGHLY recommended.  If you have any sort of pain, tightness or discomfort anywhere in your body - or you want to insure against the aging process - if you work with PCs, do any kind of handwork, suffer from tension or stress - in other words, everyone!

Title: N/A

reviewText: Wow, this video is organized, well thought out, isn't tedious or repetitive? Hooray! The instructor doesn't lecture, but instead while doing the stretches she gives tips and reminders to maintain good posture, etc. Her instructions are simple but effective enough to lead a beginner -- my 11 yr old did the first part of the tape with me today and didn't need any help. Jill Miller is great. She comes across as a real person -- her hair isn't perfect, she has genuine warmth in her eyes, and she speaks in a conversational, casual voice. The way she gives the clinical names for the different muscles is great, and it reminds me that my body is made up of many intricate parts. Jill's attitude and encouragement is refreshing, and I definitely feel looser and better overall after doing even 15 minutes of the QuickFix.I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 because I would like her to give more reminders to stand straight, keep relaxed, and not push yourself too hard.

reviewText: I am a connoisseur of rehab, yoga, and stretch videos. I have owned numerous videos, tried out numerous videos, and returned numerous videos. This video is an excellent, excellent video. I have been dealing with some neck and shoulder issues for five years now and this video has been the thing that finally gave me some relief. I am faithful to use it daily, which I recommend. The short sequences are great. My favorite is the neck sequences. They are so relieving to my sore neck and the relief is lasting.
summary: If I could give it an extra star I would
